From: <twall@...>
Subject: Re: [junit] a test framework to codify levelizaton?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=106503903

On 19.07.2004 10:59:48, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:

>Timothy Wall wrote:
>
>>  > So we were already using an informal level system, as you can
>see.
>> 
>> Until the tools get up to the task, it's usually *not* worth
>> formalizing it.
>
>If we don't formalize it, then how will we ever know we can reliably 
>automate it?
>

Yes, to automate one needs to formalize, but the one making use of the automation does not have to be the one to come up with the general formalization on which the automation is based.  

I meant continue to use a manual, informal system until a formal system becomes available onto which you can map or refactor your informal one.
subject: Re: [junit] a test framework to codify levelizaton?
